skill.name: testing-anti-patterns
skill.description: Use when writing or changing tests, adding mocks, or tempted to add test-only methods to production code - prevents testing mock behavior, production pollution with test-only methods, and mocking without understanding dependencies
skill.summary: Use when writing or changing tests, adding mocks, or tempted to add test-only methods to production ...
skill.author: DYAI2025

security_audit.summary: This is a pure documentation skill with no executable code. It contains only markdown documentation about testing best practices and anti-patterns. No security risks detected.

content.value_statement: Developers waste time writing tests that verify mocks instead of real behavior. This skill prevents five common testing anti-patterns by enforcing TDD principles and providing gate functions before each test decision.
actual_capabilities: Identifies 5 major testing anti-patterns with code examples
Provides gate functions to prevent anti-pattern decisions
Enforces TDD principles to avoid mock testing
Documents real vs mock behavior testing strategies
limitations: Only covers testing anti-patterns, not general testing

use_cases.title: Fix React component testing
use_cases.description: Stop testing mock components and start testing real React component behavior with proper isolation strategies.

use_cases.title: Clean up test-only code
use_cases.description: Remove test-only methods from production classes and move cleanup logic to proper test utilities.

use_cases.title: Establish testing standards
use_cases.description: Set team guidelines that prevent mock-heavy tests and promote integration testing where appropriate.

prompt_templates.title: Review test for anti-patterns
prompt_templates.prompt: Review this test for anti-patterns: testing mock behavior, test-only methods, or mocking without understanding. Suggest improvements following TDD principles.

prompt_templates.title: Fix mock-heavy tests
prompt_templates.prompt: These tests are mostly mock setup. Help refactor to test real behavior or suggest if integration tests would be simpler.

prompt_templates.title: Design test strategy
prompt_templates.prompt: Design a test strategy for this feature that avoids anti-patterns. What should we mock vs test with real implementations?

prompt_templates.title: Audit existing tests
prompt_templates.prompt: Audit these test files for the five anti-patterns. Identify specific violations and provide refactoring examples.

output_examples.input: Review this test for anti-patterns: test('sidebar renders', () => { render(<Page />); expect(screen.getByTestId('sidebar-mock')).toBeInTheDocument(); });
output: Problem: Asserting on mock element with test ID 'sidebar-mock'
Fix: Test real sidebar behavior instead
Alternative: Remove mock and test actual Page component

best_practices: Always test real behavior first, add mocks only when necessary for isolation
Run tests with real implementations before adding any mocks
Move test-only code to separate test utilities, never in production classes
anti_patterns: Testing that mocks exist rather than testing component behavior
Adding methods to production classes that are only used by tests
Creating partial mocks that don't mirror real API structures completely

faq.question: Is this skill compatible with all testing frameworks?
faq.answer: Yes, the principles apply to Jest, Vitest, Mocha, and any framework using mocks. Examples use React Testing Library syntax.

faq.question: What are the limitations of this approach?
faq.answer: Focuses on JavaScript/TypeScript testing. Requires understanding of mocking concepts and TDD principles for full benefit.

faq.question: How does this integrate with existing test suites?
faq.answer: Use it to audit and refactor existing tests. Apply gate functions before writing new tests to prevent anti-patterns from the start.

faq.question: Is my test data safe when using this skill?
faq.answer: Yes, this is documentation-only skill with no code execution. It only provides guidance and examples for writing better tests.

faq.question: My tests keep breaking when I remove mocks. What should I do?
faq.answer: This indicates missing abstractions or overly coupled code. Consider integration tests or refactor to better isolate external dependencies.

faq.question: How is this different from general testing best practices?
faq.answer: This skill specifically targets the five most common anti-patterns that even experienced developers create when not following TDD strictly.
